subject: [Lab 08] Q9: Shuffle
content:
Q9: Shuffle

Please post all questions you have below concerning Q9: Shuffle in the follow-ups.

If you are stuck on this question, feel free to read through the follow-up responses to see if you can draw any ideas from them.

threads.question: PS C:\Users\...\cs61a\lab\lab08> python ok -q shuffle     =====================================================================     Assignment: Lab 8     OK, version v1.14.15     =====================================================================          ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~     Running tests          Traceback (most recent call last):       File "C:\Users\...\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\runpy.py", line 193, in _run_module_as_main         "__main__", mod_spec)       File "C:\Users\...\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code         exec(code, run_globals)       File "ok\__main__.py", line 46, in <module>       File "ok\client\cli\ok.py", line 209, in main       File "ok\client\protocols\grading.py", line 46, in run       File "ok\client\protocols\grading.py", line 62, in grade       File "ok\client\sources\ok_test\models.py", line 69, in run       File "ok\client\sources\ok_test\doctest.py", line 70, in run         # 3. Doctest Parser       File "ok\client\sources\ok_test\models.py", line 253, in _run_case       File "ok\client\sources\common\interpreter.py", line 44, in run       File "ok\client\sources\common\interpreter.py", line 181, in interpret       File "ok\client\sources\common\interpreter.py", line 233, in _interpret_lines       File "ok\client\utils\output.py", line 57, in write       File "C:\Users\...\AppData\Local\Programs\Python\Python37\lib\encodings\cp1252.py", line 19, in encode         return codecs.charmap_encode(input,self.errors,encoding_table)[0]     UnicodeEncodeError: 'charmap' codec can't encode character '\u2661' in position 14: character maps to <undefined>  Anyone know what's causing this

follow-ups.feedback: I'm getting this too; i'm assuming it's a problem with the autograder
Iâ€™m actually not getting that error. Maybe the problem is confined to Windows?
Likely. Probably has something to do with the unnecessarily complex characters in the doctests

[shuffle.py](/redirect/s3?bucket=uploads&prefix=attach%2Fjziyku5gomy7aq%2Fjn6gqa2tVwNe%2Fk229j04xpba1%2Fshuffle.py)     Try replacing `tests/shuffle.py` with this to see if the issue goes away. I removed the suits and replaced them with the first letter of the suit.
Thanks! Could you upload it to pastebin or something? I'm not seeing the file
I just updated the above comment to include the missing link.

threads.question: What does it mean that range has no attribute 'insert'  half_1.insert(i*2+1, half_2[i])   AttributeError: 'range' object has no attribute 'insert'                for i in range(len(cards)//2):           half_1.insert(i*2+1, half_2[i])       return half_1

follow-ups.feedback: It looks like `half_1` is the result of calling the `range` method. Did you initialize `half_1` correctly?

half_1 = cards[:len(cards)//2]       half_2 = cards[len(cards)//2:]       for i in range(len(cards)//2):           half_1.insert(i*2+1, half_2[i])       return half_1              this is the full code. I do not call the range. so confusing
